message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CR, cs.SI, cs.DS

This paper discusses belief fusion and fission, which are concepts commonly used in artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) for combining and revising beliefs or evidence. Therefore, cs.AI and cs.LG are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also mentions Bayesian belief networks, which are used in cryptography and security (cs.CR) as well as in data science (cs.DS). Finally, the paper's focus on subjective logic and belief functions suggests a possible fit with the sub-category of social and information networks (cs.SI).
